newsitem.title: USA: AFTER THE BELL - Dell rises on earnings.
newsitem.headline: AFTER THE BELL - Dell rises on earnings.

text.p: Dell Computer Corp's stock rose to 101-1/4 in after-hours trading against a Nasdaq close of 99-5/8 after the company released higher first-quarter earnings, dealers said Tuesday.
One trader said the stock was one of the more active in the after hours session.
Dell reported a profit of $1.08 a share on revenues of $2.6 billion against a much lower $0.42 on $1.6 billion for the same period last year.
Computer Associates was trading at 54-1/4 on the Pacific Stock Exchange against a close of 52-1/8.
Computer Associates also released its earnings, reporting a profit of $0.90 a share on revenues of $1.21 billion against $0.70 on $1.11 billion a year ago.

Intel Corp enjoyed moderate activity in the after-hours session in New York, rising 1/2 on the close to 161-1/2, while IBM Corp edged up to 173-3/4 against a close of 173-1/2, according to another dealer.
The New York Stock Exchange said Tuesday that session one had a volume of 9,600 shares against the previous day's 22,000. Session two had 3.7 million against no volume on Monday, it added.
